item.title: Melissa Jay Smith
item.description: img { border-radius: 50%; } Thanks for visiting my website! My name is Melissa Smith, and I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Biostatistics at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. My statistical research interests are in the areas of Bayesian statistics, disease mapping, spatial statistics, and mediation analysis. I also enjoy collaborating with researchers across disciplines on studies in public health and medicine.

item.title: Resources for students
item.description: Mentorship programs (undergraduate, pre-graduate, and/or pre-PhD) Project SHORT: “Comprised of volunteer professional health and graduate students, residents, faculty, and post-docs, Project SHORT (Students for Higher-Ed Opportunities and Representation in Training) is the first organization to offer pro bono mentoring for both professional health and graduate school admissions.” (Project SHORT website) Project SHORT has both a mentorship program and many resources on the graduate school application process, interview process, etc.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics The Iowa Summer Institute in Biostatistics (ISIB) is an NIH-funded summer institute focused on introducing undergraduates to the field of biostatistics. While at Iowa, I have had the opportunity to serve as both a Lab Instructor and Project Mentor for the ISIB program. Lab Instructor for BIOS:4110 General Biostatistics (Summer 2019, Summer 2021) Project Mentor (Summer 2021) University of Iowa
